intro: Fumaria minor, commonly known as common fumitory, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and northern Africa. It is a low-growing annual herb with slender, trailing stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and covered in fine hairs. Fumaria minor is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in meadows, and it is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
